p: The known oleanonic acid ( 158), 3- epi-oleanolic acid ( 159), oleanolic acid ( 160) and ekeberin A ( 161) (Fig. 33) were also isolated from the leaves of Ekebergia capensis by Irungu et al. [ 80]. The four oleanane triterpenes potently inhibited the D6 and W2 strains of P. falciparum with IC 50 values ranging from 38.8 to 205.0 µM and from 76.7 to 179.4 µM, respectively, against both strains.
